conditions: No less than 120 days’ notice, nor more than one year notice
Sign the current form of the Franchise Agreement
Be in compliance with current Franchise Agreement
Satisfy current standards for new franchisees
Modify your AHS Business and operations to conform with current Operations Manual

termination_by_franchisor: Force majeure event that prevents franchisor from performing obligations and continues for longer than six months
Inability or unwillingness to operate your AHS Business
Certain violations of the Franchise Agreement
Engaging in illegal or unethical practices
Sales activity in the territory of another AHS Business
Violation of non-compete or other in-term restrictive covenant
A guaranty becomes unenforceable or inadequate
termination_by_franchisee: Franchisor materially breaches the Franchise Agreement
Franchisor provides written notice within 30 days of the breach and a reasonable opportunity to cure of not less than 90 days (subject to state law)

conditions: Escrow of an amount equal to 1% of the greater of the Gross Revenues or your Minimum Annual Gross Revenues for the prior 12 months to cover warranty and customer dispute issues
Release signed by you (except where prohibited by law)

dispute_resolution.mediation_details: Except for certain claims, all disputes must be arbitrated in Denver, Colorado (subject to state law). If a claim can be brought in court, both you and we agree to waive our rights to a jury trial.
dispute_resolution.arbitration_details: Except for certain claims, all disputes must be arbitrated in Denver, Colorado (subject to state law). If a claim can be brought in court, both you and we agree to waive our rights to a jury trial.
dispute_resolution.governing_law: Federal and Colorado law applies (subject to state law)

non_compete.geographic_scope: within 25 miles from the closest point to the former Territory or the Territory of any other AHS Business (including after assignment)
non_compete.activities_restricted: Owning, operating or performing service for a competing business

post_termination_obligations: Escrow of an amount equal to 1% of the greater of the Gross Revenues or your Minimum Annual Gross Revenues for the prior 12 months to cover warranty and customer dispute issues
Payment of an amount equal to the Royalty Fees based on the Minimum Annual Gross Revenues due over the remaining term under the Franchise Agreement, if terminated due to your default
Assign all pending and contract business to us
